results.title: Memories of Mookie
results.brief_description: Ben Edwards remembers his cousin Mookie. He was his friend and his hero and he shouldn’t have died. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Arts Victoria and the Koorie Heritage Trust Inc.

results.title: My car : my place
results.creator_credit: Bridget Nicholson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Bridget Nicholson’s car represents many things to her. More than a way to get from A to B, her car is a private place, a safe place and has intensified the freedom of travel. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Arts Victoria and the Community Support Fund.

results.creator_credit: Rowena Ashley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Whether in the city or a small town, Rowena Ashley’s son Michael has had to endure racism from a young age. This is a story about achieving against the odds. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Arts Victoria and the Community Support Fund.

results.title: Blokes and sheds
results.creator_credit: Robi Watt, Sarah Wishart, Australian Film Commission, SBS Independent, South Australian Film Corporation and Mark Thomson
results.brief_description:
The backyard shed is an Australian icon. It may appear, to the unenlightened, to be a tacked-together corrugated iron structure full of junk, nails and spiders. In truth, it has become a peculiarly Australian horde of stories and myths about isolation, masculinity, identity, capability, self esteem, tradition and even passionate obsession. It is history on a very human scale, a one-person size record of a life. There is a mystery to a shed, with dark corners; yet grace, too in odd and unexpected ways. By talking to the owners and occupiers of twelve vastly diverse sheds all over South Australia, ‘Blokes and Sheds’ casts a gentle enquiring light into those cobwebbed nooks and crannies to tease out many paradoxes and passions. Each shed is the setting for its owner to open their hearts and share their stories in these twelve, two-minute documentaries.
Based on the book by Mark Thomson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robi Watt, Sarah Wishart, Australian Film Commission, SBS Independent, South Australian Film Corporation and Mark Thomson
